revised_title: Advancements in Industrial Electrochemistry: Chemically Modified Electrodes for Enhanced Electrocatalysis
tldr: This article discusses the advancements in industrial electrochemistry, specifically focusing on chemically modified electrodes for enhanced electrocatalysis. The author explores various types of electrocatalysis, including self-catalysis, negative catalysis, and interface redox polymer systems. The article also highlights the potential of polymeric multimolecular layer films to greatly enhance electrocatalytic rates.
